DESCRIPTION.P: This block realizes the visualization of the evolution of the signals on the standard input port(s) at instants of events on the event input port.

ITEMIZE.label: DIALOGUE PARAMETERS
ITEMIZE.ITEM: : a vector of integers. The i-th element is the color number (>0) or dash type (<0) used to draw the evolution of the i-th input port signal. See plot2d for color (dash type) definitions.

: The number of graphic window used for the display. It is often good to use high values to avoid conflict with palettes and Super Block windows. If you have more than one scope, make sure they don't have the same window numbers (unless superposition of the curves is desired).
: a 2 vector specifying the coordinates of the upper left corner of the graphic window. Answer [] for default window position.
: a 2 vector specifying the width and height of the graphic window. Answer [] for default window dimensions.
: Minimum and maximum values of the input; used to set up the Y-axis of the plot in the graphics window.
: Maximum value on the X-axis (time). The plot is redrawn when time reaches a multiple of this value.
: To improve efficiency it is possible to buffer the input data. The drawing is only done after each Buffer size call to the block.

: if 0 SCOPE_f draws a new point only when an event occurs on its event input port. if 1 SCOPE_f draws a new point when an event occurs on its event input port and when it's regular input changes due to an event on an other upstrem block (herited events).

ITEMIZE.label: REMARKS
ITEMIZE.P: Output window number, Output window size, Output window position are only taken into account at the initialisation time of the simulation.
